results.title: Physical education for children
results.creator_credit: Faculty of Education and Glenn Kirchner
results.brief_description: Shows how the basic needs and interests of primary school age children are translated into a physical education program, The nature and role of intramural activities and programs for exceptional children are also covered.

results.title: Physical education at Crows Nest, Queenscliff
results.creator_credit: Owen Brothers Animated Films, Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and E.J. Perry
results.brief_description: A Victorian Education Department film detailing the physical education camp at Queenscliff for student teachers from the Ballarat, Bendigo and Melbourne Teacher’s Colleges. The student teachers learnt games, folk dancing and limited gymnastics. Commentary by Lloyd Williams.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Owen Brothers Animated Films, Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and E.J. Perry

results.title: Physical education activities for the classroom
results.creator_credit: Simon Fraser University and Ian Andrews
results.brief_description: Shows how the classroom can be effectively used to conduct fitness activities, yoga exercises, modified games, and creative dance. For teachers without access to the gymnasium or playing field.

results.title: Physical chemistry of polymers
results.creator_credit: Bell Telephone Laboratories, Sol Dworkin and John Friedman
results.brief_description: Dr. F H Winslow discusses how the physical properties of polymers are affected by molecular size and shape, the packing of molecular clusters as well as the strength of forces between molecules. Includes experiments and demonstrations one of which visually simulates the effects of thermal agitation on rubber molecules.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bell Telephone Laboratories, Sol Dworkin and John Friedman

results.title: Physcial Education Activities for the Classroom (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A useful and informative film for classroom teachers who do not have daily access to the gymnasium or playing field. It illustrates how the classroom can be effectively used to conduct fitness activities, yoga exercises, modified games, folk and creative dance and many more exciting and challenging activities
results.description: A useful and informative film for classroom teachers who do not have daily access to the gymnasium or playing field. results.title: Photosynthesis: The Biochemical process
results.brief_description: From the sun, to green plant, to chloroplasts to grana, this film focuses on the basic life-sustaining process of photosynthesis. The approach is experimental: paper, chromatography, variable lights, spectrophotometric analysis and re-creation of the experiments of Theodore Engelmann, and Melvin Calvin illustrate the physics and chemistry of the photosynthetic process.
results.description: From the sun, to green plant, to chloroplasts to grana, this film focuses on the basic life-sustaining process of photosynthesis. The approach is experimental: paper, chromatography, variable lights, spectrophotometric analysis and re-creation of the experiments of Theodore Engelmann, and Melvin Calvin illustrate the physics and chemistry of the photosynthetic process.

results.title: Photosynthesis. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and John Walker
results.brief_description: Shows how the application of the scientific method has revealed the mechanism by which green plants transform light energy into food. Controlled experiments test the photosynthesis process and shows how each components - light, carbon dioxide, water, and chloroplasts is essential. Also introduces several advanced concepts, such as the formation of intermediate compounds and the effect of different types of light.
results.description: Shows how the application of the scientific method has revealed the mechanism by which green plants transform light energy into food. Also introduces several advanced concepts, such as the formation of intermediate compounds and the effect of different types of light.

results.title: Photosynthesis (3rd edition)
results.brief_description: Presents a series of basic experiments that explain the various processes of photosynthesis. Explains the elements of ATP and NADPH and discusses their importance to the photosynthetic process. Discusses current and future uses for the photosynthetic process in relation to the earth’s energy sources.
results.description: Presents a series of basic experiments that explain the various processes of photosynthesis. Discusses current and future uses for the photosynthetic process in relation to the earth’s energy sources.

results.title: Photosynthesis
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Michael Birch
results.brief_description: Explains how green plants transform light energy into food by the process of photosynthesis. Shows the process by which carbon dioxide and water - in the presence of light and chlorophyll - react to produce sugar and release oxygen.

results.title: Photons
results.creator_credit: Physical Science Study Committee, Stephen White and Wallace Worsley
results.brief_description: John King demonstrates particular like behaviours of light, using a photomultiplier and oscilloscope output to observe a weak intermittent light source.
